content:
AA 342 is a convenient non-stop flight that'll get you to Seattle quickly.

Regarding the connecting flights, I'd be happy to provide more details on the layovers:

**AA 2243 (ORD-PHX-SEA)**

* Departing ORD at 6:00 AM (CST) on May 10
* Layover in Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport (PHX) for 1 hour and 35 minutes
* Departing PHX at 9:35 AM (MST) on May 10
* Arriving at SEA at 10:35 AM (PST) on May 10

The layover in PHX is relatively short, but you'll need to factor in the time zone change from Central to Mountain Time. You'll have enough time to grab a quick bite or stretch your legs before boarding the connecting flight.

**AA 2163 (ORD-DFW-SEA)**

* Departing ORD at 7:30 AM (CST) on May 10
* Layover in Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) for 2 hours and 15 minutes
* Departing DFW at 10:45 AM (CDT) on May 10
* Arriving at SEA at 11:35 AM (PST) on May 10

The layover in DFW is a bit longer, but you'll have more time to grab a meal or do some work before boarding the connecting flight. Keep in mind that DFW is a larger airport, so you might need to factor in some extra time to get to your gate.

Both layovers are manageable, but if you're short on time or prefer a more relaxed travel experience, the non-stop AA 342 might be a better fit.

Now that you have more information, are you ready to book AA 342 or would you like to explore other options?
